Class EncodeUpca

java.lang.Object
EncodeUpca
public class EncodeUpca extends Object
The EncodeUpca class provides methods to encode UPCA product codes into binary representations.

    • ENCODE_LEFT

  • Constructor Details

      public EncodeUpca()
      Constructor for EncodeUpca class. Initializes the productCode to be an empty string.

  • Method Details

    • setProductCode

      public static void setProductCode(String productCode)
      Setter for setting the product code. This method checks for a valid productCode entry. productCode must be 11 digits long. If valid, product code is set to provided value. If not valid, product code is set as a default "11111111111" value.
      Parameters:
      productCode - product code to bet set.

    • getProductCode

      public static String getProductCode()
      Getter for the currently set productCode.
      Returns:
      productCode as a string.

    • getCheckDigit

      public static int getCheckDigit(String productCode)
      Calculate the check digit for the product code. This method takes the product code string as input and calculates its check digit value based off of UPCA encoding rules. The check digit is added at the end of the product code to form a complete UPCA code.
      Parameters:
      productCode - The UPCA product code string to calculate its check digit value.
      Returns:
      The calculated check digit as in integer.

    • getBinaryRep

      public static String getBinaryRep(String productCode)
      Encode a UPCA product code and its check digit into a binary representation. This method takes a product code as input. Its check digit gets calculated and added onto the end of itself in a new string called productCodeWithCheckDigit. StringBuilder is used to make the encoded string. It first adds '101' to the front as the left 'frame'. Encodes the left side of the product code, adds in the center 'frame' and then encodes the right side. '101' is then added as the right 'frame' and the complete encoded UPCA is returned as a string.
      Parameters:
      productCode - product code string to be encoded.
      Returns:
      The binary representation of the UPCA code.
